measured_by: Delayed-intention drag-and-drop circle task with optional external reminders (Dupont et al., 2022)
justification: “Dupont et al. administered a task where participants used a touchscreen tablet or their computer mouse to drag numbered circles… In some conditions participants were able to set external reminders, to help them remember the special circles.”

measured_by: Proportion of circles for which participants created external reminders in the drag-and-drop task
justification: “When allowed to set reminders, participants did this more often for high- than low-value items (Experiment 1).”  The frequency of reminder creation serves as the quantitative index of offloading.

measured_by: Surprise memory test after external reminders are removed
justification: “When reminders were removed and participants were tested on a surprise memory test, their memory for high-value items was reduced, compared with a condition where they never set reminders.”  Performance on this unexpected test is used to gauge internal memory.

measured_by: Accuracy difference between high-value and low-value items when relying on internal memory only
justification: “When forced to rely on internal memory, accuracy for high-value items was higher than low-value items… This replicates a basic principle of value-based remembering: people typically have better memory for items associated with higher reward.”
